Title: Good camera
Cons: Actually a little small as strange as that may sound.  People with larger hands will need to keep it on their wrist.
Pros: Great camera, the pictures are crisp and not saturated.  Beautiful LCD, takes pictures right when you push the button.  Good little charger that comes with it too, very easy to take places.

Cons: Eight months the lens mechanism has just given up with a "Lens error, restart camera." All in all, I'm not sure it was worth it, which is really a bummer because I really liked it...
Pros: Great little guy-- small, light, takes amazing pictures.

Cons: the grey area on the camera seems prone to being dirty.  Mine; already out the box not even a day old seems to have oil stains.
Pros: everything you would need in a point and shoot camera.  You can't beat the price for the features you get in it along with the quality.

Title: Great Camera - Not the best Price
Cons:
Got it on a "major retailers website named after a jungle" (hopefully that is less offensive) for $150, so NewEggs price, for once in my life, isn't the best.
Small Sensor doesn't capture all of the detail despite being 10MP.
Pros:
Great Res
Bright Saturated Pictures
Easy to Use
SD cards are cheap - this could double as a light duty video camera

Cons: none
Pros: I couldn't ask for a better camera to take on my deployment to Iraq. It's small and lightweight which make is easy to carry everywhere I go. Even at full zoom where it looks fuzzy on the screen, the picture still has a fantastic resolution on the computer.

Title: Perfect Point & Shoot
Cons: None really, though it is so small it takes big hands a little time to adjust to using it.
Pros: High megapixels, large LCD, long battery life, and good zoom considering its size.  It also works very well in the waterproof case for underwater shots.
Comments: My wife and I got this for our honeymoon.  We already have a Canon Digital Rebel XT, but we wanted something smaller that we could take with us anywhere.  This camera was perfect.  We went ice climbing, rock climbing, kayaking, and even snorkeling with it (we bought the waterproof case for it).  I just kept it in my pocket, something I definitely couldn't have done with our SLR.

Title: fantastic camera
Cons: none
Pros: got this camera for my wife as a companion to our Canon 20D. She is totally in love with this camera. Buttons are easy to manipulate, LCD is nice and clear, battery life is quite good, and it's a rechargable! Plenty of features, this camera will just about do it all. I can't think of anything she's wanted to do but couldn't due to a limitation of the camera. I'm half tempted to get one for myself just to have in the car.
Comments: I only wish it would take the high cap SD cards but oh well, a 4g SD card will hold an unreal amount of pictures on this thing, about 1000 I think. Fantastic little camera.

Title: GREAT little Point and Shoot!
Cons: 3x optical zoom seems kinda meager, but it's a small P&S so I wasn't expecting much along those lines. Sometimes flash makes photos look washed out.
Pros: Tiny! Great battery life. Takes great pictures & videos. Light. Seems pretty rugged.
Comments: When I first got this camera, I compared the quality with my Canon 300D (D-SLR) and on some of the shots it was really difficult to tell the difference. It's definitely not DSLR quality you don't quite have the control that you would, but then again, it doesn't cost anywhere near what a DSLR would and it is a LOT easier to just toss in your pocket and go. Especially if you have young children. I love this camera! I take it with me everywhere now when I don't feel like dragging the 300D around.

Cons:
Only 3x Optical Zoom, don't know if thats a con
No option to keep flash on ALL the time, so some pictures are forced dark if the room is super bright and your not facing the right way.
Pros:
SUPER small, even to the models simular to it.
2-Toned with black and silver.
Super long lasting battery, I charged it once and been taking pictures everyday with it for the past few weeks!
Same ole features from almost any other canon.
Comments: Get alot of compliments on how nice and high tech the camera looks.

Title: User friendly
Cons: Haven't found any.
Pros: Easy to navigate menu with tons of photo options.  I upgraded from an older model Canon powershot and could not be happier.
